segment.source: Connect other devices and display with Surface Hub
segment.target: Connect other devices and display with Surface Hub

segment.source: You can connect other device to your Surface Hub to display content.
segment.target: You can connect other device to your Surface Hub to display content.

segment.source: This topic describes guest mode and replacement PC modes that is available through a wired connection.
segment.target: This topic describes guest mode and replacement PC modes that is available through a wired connection.

segment.source: Connect other devices and display with Surface Hub
segment.target: Connect other devices and display with Surface Hub

segment.source: You can connect other device to your Surface Hub to display content.
segment.target: You can connect other device to your Surface Hub to display content.

segment.source: This topic describes guest mode and replacement PC modes that is available through a wired connection.
segment.target: This topic describes guest mode and replacement PC modes that is available through a wired connection.

segment.source: Guest mode uses a wired connection, so people can display content from their devices to the Surface Hub.
segment.target: Guest mode uses a wired connection, so people can display content from their devices to the Surface Hub.

segment.source: If the source device is Windows based, that device can also provide Touchback and Inkback.
segment.target: If the source device is Windows based, that device can also provide Touchback and Inkback.

segment.source: Surface Hub's internal PC takes video and audio from the connected device and displays them on the Surface Hub.
segment.target: Surface Hub's internal PC takes video and audio from the connected device and displays them on the Surface Hub.

segment.source: If Surface Hub encounters an HDCP signal, the source will be re-routed through an alternate path, allowing the source to be displayed full-screen without violating HDCP requirements.
segment.target: If Surface Hub encounters an HDCP signal, the source will be re-routed through an alternate path, allowing the source to be displayed full-screen without violating HDCP requirements.

segment.source: Use these ports on the Surface Hub for the guest mode.
segment.target: Use these ports on the Surface Hub for the guest mode.

segment.source: Support simultaneous guest input display with guest input #2 and guest input #3 (one full resolution, two thumbnail).
segment.target: Support simultaneous guest input display with guest input #2 and guest input #3 (one full resolution, two thumbnail).

segment.source: Support simultaneous guest input display with guest input #1 and guest input #3 (one full resolution, two thumbnail).
segment.target: Support simultaneous guest input display with guest input #1 and guest input #3 (one full resolution, two thumbnail).

segment.source: Support simultaneous guest input display with guest input #1 and guest input #2 (one full resolution, two thumbnail).
segment.target: Support simultaneous guest input display with guest input #1 and guest input #2 (one full resolution, two thumbnail).

segment.source: Ingest into Surface Hub PC, usually with the VGA video input.
segment.target: Ingest into Surface Hub PC, usually with the VGA video input.

segment.source: Provides access to the HID input devices mouse, touch, keyboard, and stylus back to the guest PC.
segment.target: Provides access to the HID input devices mouse, touch, keyboard, and stylus back to the guest PC.

segment.source: These are the port connections used for guest mode on the 55" and 84" Surface Hubs.
segment.target: These are the port connections used for guest mode on the 55" and 84" Surface Hubs.

segment.source: image showing guest ports on 55" surface hub.
segment.target: image showing guest ports on 55" surface hub.

segment.source: Wired port connections on 55" Surface Hub
segment.target: Wired port connections on 55" Surface Hub

segment.source: image showing guest ports on 84" surface hub.
segment.target: image showing guest ports on 84" surface hub.

segment.source: Wired port connections on 84" Surface Hub
segment.target: Wired port connections on 84" Surface Hub

segment.source: When a Surface hub is connected to guest computer with the wired connect USB port, a number of USB devices are discovered and configured.
segment.target: When a Surface hub is connected to guest computer with the wired connect USB port, a number of USB devices are discovered and configured.

segment.source: These peripheral devices are created for touchback and inkback.
segment.target: These peripheral devices are created for touchback and inkback.

segment.source: The peripheral devices can viewed in Device Manager.
segment.target: The peripheral devices can viewed in Device Manager.

segment.source: Device Manager will show duplicate names for some devices.
segment.target: Device Manager will show duplicate names for some devices.

segment.source: Your choice of video cable will be determined by what is available from your source input.
segment.target: Your choice of video cable will be determined by what is available from your source input.

segment.source: The Surface Hub has three choices of video input, DisplayPort, HDMI and VGA.
segment.target: The Surface Hub has three choices of video input, DisplayPort, HDMI and VGA.

segment.source: Please refer to the below chart for available resolutions.
segment.target: Please refer to the below chart for available resolutions.

segment.source: Source audio is provided by DisplayPort and HDMI cables.
segment.target: Source audio is provided by DisplayPort and HDMI cables.

segment.source: If you must use VGA, Surface Hub has an audio input port that uses a 3.5 mm plug.
segment.target: If you must use VGA, Surface Hub has an audio input port that uses a 3.5 mm plug.

segment.source: Surface Hub also uses a USB cable that provides touch and inkback from the Surface Hub to compatible Windows 10 devices.
segment.target: Surface Hub also uses a USB cable that provides touch and inkback from the Surface Hub to compatible Windows 10 devices.

segment.source: The USB cable can be used with any video input that is already connected with a cable.
segment.target: The USB cable can be used with any video input that is already connected with a cable.

segment.source: Someone using guest mode to connect a PC would use one of these options:
segment.target: Someone using guest mode to connect a PC would use one of these options:

segment.source: DisplayPort -- DisplayPort cable and USB 2.0 cable
segment.target: DisplayPort -- DisplayPort cable and USB 2.0 cable

segment.source: HDMI -- HDMI cable and USB 2.0 cable
segment.target: HDMI -- HDMI cable and USB 2.0 cable

segment.source: VGA -- VGA cable, 3.5 mm audio cable, and USB 2.0 cable
segment.target: VGA -- VGA cable, 3.5 mm audio cable, and USB 2.0 cable

segment.source: If the computer you are using for guest mode is not compatible with Touch and Inkback, then you won't need the USB cable.
segment.target: If the computer you are using for guest mode is not compatible with Touch and Inkback, then you won't need the USB cable.

segment.source: In replacement PC mode, the embedded computer of the Surface Hub is turned off and an external PC is connected to the Surface Hub.
segment.target: In replacement PC mode, the embedded computer of the Surface Hub is turned off and an external PC is connected to the Surface Hub.

segment.source: Connections to replacement PC ports give access to key peripherals on the Surface Hub, including the screen, pen, and touch features.
segment.target: Connections to replacement PC ports give access to key peripherals on the Surface Hub, including the screen, pen, and touch features.

segment.source: This does mean that your Surface Hub won’t have the benefit of the Windows Team experience, but you will have the flexibility offered by providing and managing your own Windows computer.
segment.target: This does mean that your Surface Hub won’t have the benefit of the Windows Team experience, but you will have the flexibility offered by providing and managing your own Windows computer.

segment.source: You can run Surface Hub in replacement PC mode with 64-bit versions of Windows 10 Home, Windows 10 Pro and Windows 10 Enterprise.
segment.target: You can run Surface Hub in replacement PC mode with 64-bit versions of Windows 10 Home, Windows 10 Pro and Windows 10 Enterprise.

segment.source: You can download the Surface Hub Replacement PC driver package from the Microsoft download center.
segment.target: You can download the Surface Hub Replacement PC driver package from the Microsoft download center.

segment.source: We recommend that you install these drivers on any computer you plan to use as a replacement PC.
segment.target: We recommend that you install these drivers on any computer you plan to use as a replacement PC.

segment.source: Surface Hub is compatible with a range of hardware.
segment.target: Surface Hub is compatible with a range of hardware.

segment.source: Choose the processor and memory confirmation for your replacement PC so that it supports the programs you'll be using.
segment.target: Choose the processor and memory confirmation for your replacement PC so that it supports the programs you'll be using.

segment.source: Your replacement PC hardware needs to support 64-bit versions of Windows 10.
segment.target: Your replacement PC hardware needs to support 64-bit versions of Windows 10.

segment.source: In replacement PC mode, Surface Hub supports any graphics adapter that can produce a DisplayPort signal.
segment.target: In replacement PC mode, Surface Hub supports any graphics adapter that can produce a DisplayPort signal.

segment.source: You'll improve your experience with a graphics adapter that can match Surface Hub's resolution and refresh rate.
segment.target: You'll improve your experience with a graphics adapter that can match Surface Hub's resolution and refresh rate.

segment.source: For example, though the best and recommended replacement PC experience on the Surface Hub is with a 120Hz video signal, 60Hz video signals are also supported.
segment.target: For example, though the best and recommended replacement PC experience on the Surface Hub is with a 120Hz video signal, 60Hz video signals are also supported.

segment.source: 55" Surface Hubs - For best experience, use a graphics card capable of 1080p resolution at 120Hz.
segment.target: 55" Surface Hubs - For best experience, use a graphics card capable of 1080p resolution at 120Hz.

segment.source: 84" Surface Hubs - For best experience, use a graphics card capable of outputting four DisplayPort 1.2 streams to produce 2160p at 120Hz (3840 x 2160 at 120Hz vertical refresh).
segment.target: 84" Surface Hubs - For best experience, use a graphics card capable of outputting four DisplayPort 1.2 streams to produce 2160p at 120Hz (3840 x 2160 at 120Hz vertical refresh).

segment.source: We've verified that this works with the NVIDIA Quadro K2200, NVIDIA Quadro K4200, and NVIDIA Quadro M6000.
segment.target: We've verified that this works with the NVIDIA Quadro K2200, NVIDIA Quadro K4200, and NVIDIA Quadro M6000.

segment.source: These are not the only graphics cards - others are available from other vendors.
segment.target: These are not the only graphics cards - others are available from other vendors.

segment.source: Check directly with graphics card vendors for the latest drivers.
segment.target: Check directly with graphics card vendors for the latest drivers.

segment.source: Replacement PC ports on 55" Surface Hub.
segment.target: Replacement PC ports on 55" Surface Hub.

segment.source: image showing replacement pc ports on 55" surface hub.
segment.target: image showing replacement pc ports on 55" surface hub.

segment.source: Full screen display of 1080p at 120 Hz, plus audio
segment.target: Full screen display of 1080p at 120 Hz, plus audio

segment.source: Replacement PC ports on 84" Surface Hub.
segment.target: Replacement PC ports on 84" Surface Hub.

segment.source: image showing replacement pc ports on 84" surface hub.
segment.target: image showing replacement pc ports on 84" surface hub.

segment.source: Full screen display of 2160p at 120 Hz, plus audio
segment.target: Full screen display of 2160p at 120 Hz, plus audio

segment.source: Download and install the Surface Hub Replacement PC driver package on the replacement PC.
segment.target: Download and install the Surface Hub Replacement PC driver package on the replacement PC.

segment.source: Note We recommend that you set sleep or hibernation on the replacement PC so the Surface Hub will turn off the display when it isn't being used.
segment.target: Note We recommend that you set sleep or hibernation on the replacement PC so the Surface Hub will turn off the display when it isn't being used.

segment.source: Turn off the Surface Hub using the power switch next to the power cable.
segment.target: Turn off the Surface Hub using the power switch next to the power cable.

segment.source: Connect the cables from the Surface Hub's replacement PC ports to the replacement PC.
segment.target: Connect the cables from the Surface Hub's replacement PC ports to the replacement PC.

segment.source: These ports are usually covered by a removable plastic cover.
segment.target: These ports are usually covered by a removable plastic cover.

segment.source: 55" Surface Hub -- connect one DisplayPort cable, and two USB cables.
segment.target: 55" Surface Hub -- connect one DisplayPort cable, and two USB cables.

segment.source: 84" Surface Hub -- connect two DisplayPort cables, and two USB cables.
segment.target: 84" Surface Hub -- connect two DisplayPort cables, and two USB cables.

segment.source: Toggle the Mode switch to Replacement PC.
segment.target: Toggle the Mode switch to Replacement PC.

segment.source: The Mode switch is next to the Replacement PC ports.
segment.target: The Mode switch is next to the Replacement PC ports.

segment.source: Turn on the Surface Hub using the power switch next to the power cable.
segment.target: Turn on the Surface Hub using the power switch next to the power cable.

segment.source: Press the power button on the right side of the Surface Hub.
segment.target: Press the power button on the right side of the Surface Hub.

segment.source: You can switch the Surface Hub to use the internal PC.
segment.target: You can switch the Surface Hub to use the internal PC.

segment.source: To switch back to internal PC
segment.target: To switch back to internal PC

segment.source: Turn off the Surface Hub using the power switch next to the power cable.
segment.target: Turn off the Surface Hub using the power switch next to the power cable.

segment.source: Toggle the Mode switch to Internal PC.
segment.target: Toggle the Mode switch to Internal PC.

segment.source: The Mode switch is next to the Replacement PC ports.
segment.target: The Mode switch is next to the Replacement PC ports.

segment.source: Turn on the Surface Hub using the power switch next to the power cable.
segment.target: Turn on the Surface Hub using the power switch next to the power cable.
